Vichy's antisemitism: A dispute between historians heads to court
description: Eighty-three years after the Vel' d'Hiv roundup, historians who emphasize the xenophobic rather than antisemitic nature of the Vichy regime say they have been defamed and have filed several lawsuits against academics and journalists.

headline: In photos: What remains of the Paris Olympic sites?
description: One year after the Olympic Games, Paris claims a legacy that breaks with the excesses of the past. Instead of empty stadiums or abandoned wastelands, the city boasts reused facilities, transformed neighborhoods and spaces opened up to residents. Here is a look back, in pictures, at the Olympic sites.

description: Directed by Matt Shakman, the latest version of the saga takes the team of explorers into 1960s New York while weaving in references to the Old Testament.

headline: A year later, French fans relive the 'non-stop joy' of Paris 2024
description: The success of the summer 2024 event was also thanks to the fervor of fans at the competition venues. One year later, several of them recall the "incredible excitement" that swept the French capital.

headline: Montmartre residents denounce the Paris neighborhood's 'Disneyfication'

headline: In Israel, the heartbreak of Iranian Jews: 'My country was bombing my country'
